Author: FishyGuts#5085
Content: So... is everyone solo mining with their Z9s?  Seems better than joining a big pool if you have a few rigs, yeah?

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content: my rule of thumb is never join a public pool if you have enough hash to get at least 1 block a month

Author: coinr#7073
Content: Risk mitigation.  One month is too much of a long shot for me.  If its a hobby, then i guess thats fine but pools for larger hash coins average out to the same anyway over long periods

Author: ComputerGenie üë¥üèºüì¢#7004
Content:
@coinr Provided you have the hashrate to cover the overhead without digging into your own pocket (aka "one block per month"), if you enter into a public pool you are only accomplishing 3 things:
1) providing for some random stranger's retirement fund
2) helping to centralize hashrate
3) giving up all consensus rights in the efforts of 1) and 2)

Author: coinr#7073
Content: Yeah i get it, but that "overhead cost" is a killer when you are spinning a lot of machines.

Author: coinr#7073
Content: 2 or 3 bad months is brutal
